com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils

Class EpochTime

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.utils.EpochTime
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UsesCustomNull, Comparable<EpochTime>

    public class EpochTime
extends Object
implements Comparable<EpochTime>, UsesCustomNull
    A class fulfilling a similar role to Java's built-in Date, i.e. milliseconds since 1970. We don't use Date because it is mutable, which makes certain APIs in SweetBlue harder to design.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static EpochTime MAX
      Convenience instance using Long.MAX_VALUE.
      static EpochTime MIN
      Convenience instance using Long.MIN_VALUE.
      static EpochTime NULL
      Fulfills the soft contract of UsesCustomNull - used for isNull().
      static EpochTime ZERO
      Convenience instance representing the start date of 1970.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EpochTime()
      Constructs a new instance using System.currentTimeMillis().
      EpochTime(Date date)
      Converts from Java's built-in date.
      EpochTime(long millisecondsSince1970)
      Constructs a new instance using milliseconds since 1970.

      Converts to Java's built-in date class.

      Converts to milliseconds since 1970, which is currently also how the value is stored internally.
